definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome

sentences.english: He went about the job like a bull in a china shop.
sentences.chinese: 他干这种活就想公牛进了瓷器店那样莽撞。

sentences.english: The plow was pulled by a yoke of oxen.
sentences.chinese: 一对公牛同轭拉着一头犁。

sentences.english: He slaughtered the ox and the ram as the fellowship offering for the people.
sentences.chinese: 亚伦宰了那给百姓作平安祭的公牛和公绵羊。

sentences.english: The Chicago Bull bought a new guard.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥公牛队新雇了一名后卫。

sentences.english: As to sacrifice, both he and Zeus delighted most in bulls.
sentences.chinese: 朱庇特和宙斯都最喜欢将公牛作为他们的供品。

sentences.english: He was tossed by the bull.
sentences.chinese: 他被这头公牛用角挑了起来。

sentences.english: Bulls win, 88-83, they go to the finals again.
sentences.chinese: 公牛队胜出，88比83，他们再次进入总决赛。

sentences.english: Vernon charges in, stands looking blinded, like an enraged bull.
sentences.chinese: 弗农冲进来站住，两眼发直，像一头激怒了的公牛。
猴子跑得很快，公牛追不上。

sentences.english: He hung this around the mighty bullock's neck.
sentences.chinese: 他把金币包挂在公牛的脖子上。

sentences.english: As the designs evolved, it began to take on more bull-like characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 随着设计的发展，它开始被加入更多公牛的特点。

sentences.english: The bull gored the farmer to death.
sentences.chinese: 公牛用角把农夫抵死了。

sentences.english: THREE BULLS for a long time pastured together.
sentences.chinese: 有三头公牛在一块吃草已经很长时间了。

sentences.english: The bull and cow stand symbolic for dharma and the earth respectively.
sentences.chinese: 公牛和母牛分别象征达尔玛和地球。

sentences.english: Mehta said. "Have you seen a bull running?"
sentences.chinese: 麦哈塔先生说，“你看见过一只奔跑的公牛吗？

sentences.english: By the next year, the Bulls had started a winning streak.
sentences.chinese: 到第二年，芝加哥公牛队就开始了其节节胜利的战绩。

definition: horseman/cavalryman/knight (i.e. European nobility)/(Tw) bike rider (scooter, bicycle etc)
Wade (name)/Sir Thomas Francis Wade (1818-1895), sinologist 威妥瑪|威妥玛[Wei1 Tuo3 ma3]
Los Angeles Lakers/abbr. for 洛杉磯湖人|洛杉矶湖人[Luo4 shan1 ji1 Hu2 ren2]
